questions.text: A 30 year previously healthy male came with 2 days fever and cough with purulent sputum. questions.correct_answer: A. OP treatment with Clarithromycin 500mg BID for one week

questions.correct_answer: B. Second operating room needs to be opened and the operation performed regardless of his fasting time.

During the delivery of a post-term infant, who has been demonstrating late decelerations throughout labor, heavy meconium staining with particulate is noted in the amniotic fluid. Which of the following measures should be instituted during delivery room management of this infant?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct laryngoscopy with intubation and suctioning of the trachea in all infants, both vigorous and nonvigorous

options.label: B
options.text: Suctioning of the oropharynx on the perineum in all infants, both vigorous and nonvigorous

options.label: C
options.text: Direct laryngoscopy with intubation and suctioning of the trachea only in nonvigorous infants

options.label: D
options.text: Management should be guided by the same general principles for any infant with inadequate respiratory effort.

options.label: E
options.text: Chest physiotherapy in all infants, both vigorous and nonvigorous.

questions.correct_answer: D. Management should be guided by the same general principles for any infant with inadequate respiratory effort.

questions.text: During an initial examination in the newborn nursery, a term female is noted to have a single umbilical artery. She has no dysmorphic features, her height, weight, and head circumference are all at or near the 45 percentile, and the remainder of her physical examination is unremarkable. Which of the following should be included upon additional evaluation of this patient?

options.label: E
options.text: AP and lateral radiographs of the chest

questions.text: You are called to evaluate a term newborn because of abnormal findings on physical examination. Which of the following is an abnormal finding on physical examination of a term newborn?

options.label: A
options.text: The lower portion of each kidney is palpable.

options.label: B
options.text: A liver tip palpable 2 cm below the right costal margin.

options.label: C
options.text: The labia majora meet at the midline and obscure the urethra and clitoris.

options.label: D
options.text: A spleen tip palpable at the left costal margin.

questions.text: A 29-day-old boy is transferred to the hospital from an outside urgent care center. The patient was seen for persistent vomiting and was noted by the examining physician to have projectile vomiting. A small mass is palpable in the pyloric area, and peristaltic waves are detectable. Surgical consultation is requested, IV fluids are instituted, and the patient is prepared for surgical intervention. Which of the following is a recognized risk for the development of this condition?

A 30-day-old infant is referred to your unit for evaluation of cholestatic jaundice. On exam, you find a jaundiced, but alert infant. The liver is palpable and firm in the RUQ. Laboratory evaluation shows cholestasis and elevated transaminases. An ultrasound shows an absent gallbladder. A HIDA scan shows no drainage from the liver into the intestine. A liver biopsy shows bile duct proliferation suggestive of an extrahepatic obstruction. You consult pediatric surgery immediately. Surgical treatment of this disorder is recommended as soon as possible after diagnosis in infants because:

options.label: A
options.text: The bile ducts need to be removed as soon as possible to decrease risk of cholangiocarcinoma.

options.label: B
options.text: It protects extension of the fibrosis to other areas in the gastrointestinal tract.

options.label: C
options.text: There is a lower risk of eventual liver malignancy

options.label: D
options.text: Complications related to anesthesia are less common in the neonatal period.

options.label: E
options.text: There is an increased chance of successful drainage.

questions.correct_answer: E. There is an increased chance of successful drainage.

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy with a history of repair of cleft lip/palate and tetralogy of Fallot is noted to have several dysmorphic facial features, which include a long, narrowed face with a small mouth; micrognathia; narrowed palpebral fissures; and a prominent nose. Additional clinical findings include short stature and cryptorchidism. Review of this patient’s records is most likely to reveal which of the following complications in the newborn period?

You are seeing a 3-year-old male for the first time. He is very friendly and outgoing. Mentally, he is well below average. He is at the 15 percentile for weight and 5 percentile for height. He has short palpebral fissures with depressed nasal bridge, long philtrum, and prominent lips with open mouth. He has a hoarse voice and a low-pitched, rough, ejection systolic murmur heard best at the sternal edge of the second intercostal space. You also feel a thrill in the suprasternal notch. No webbing of the neck. He also has short nails. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A newborn female is evaluated in the nursery because of hypotonia, flat midface, epicanthal folds, and Brushfield spots. An echocardiogram reveals an AV canal defect. The most likely karyotype is:
During a health maintenance examination, a 4-month-old boy demonstrates clinical evidence of craniosynostosis. Which of the following best describes the most common type of craniosynostosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral premature fusion of the coronal sutures

options.label: B
options.text: Premature fusion of the midline sagittal suture

options.label: C
options.text: Premature fusion of the lambdoid suture

options.label: D
options.text: Unilateral premature fusion of a coronal suture

options.label: E
options.text: Premature fusion of the metopic suture

questions.correct_answer: B. Premature fusion of the midline sagittal suture

questions.text: A 3-year-old girl is found to have an elevated blood pressure on 4 readings over a period of 2 weeks. Which one of the following outlines the current definition of hypertension in children?

options.text: Systolic or diastolic blood pressure ? the 90th percentile for sex, age, and height percentile

options.text: Systolic and/or diastolic blood pressure ? the 95th percentile for sex, age, and height percentile

questions.correct_answer: E. Systolic and/or diastolic blood pressure ? the 95th percentile for sex, age, and height percentile

questions.text: Very early in embryonic development, testosterone is formed within the male embryo. What is the function of this hormone at this stage of development?

questions.text: Match the following regarding drugs acting on kidney and its adverse effects

questions.text: A 32 year old female presented with occasional right flank pain. Urine examination revealed following crystals. Which of the following is a false statement about this condition?

questions.text: A 20 year old man met with an cycle accident when handle of cycle hit his lower abdomen. He was brought to hospital next day with pain lower abdomen. He has not passed urine since he sustained trauma. On examination no bladder lump could be palpated and there is diffuse tenderness in lower abdomen. Ultrasound revealed a partially full bladder with free fluid in abdomen. Cystogram picture is given below. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Pass a foleys catheter and leave the catheter for2 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with non- absorbable suture

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

questions.text: A patient presented in emergency with blunt injury over head in a scuffle by a lathi injury. CT image given below. Which of the following statement is false about this condition?

questions.text: A 56-year-old woman presented to our hospital with a 6-month history of an enlarging right breast palpable lump. questions.text: A 17-year-old boy is hospitalized with recent-onset insomnia, headaches, periodic agitation, and dysphagia. He is doing research on life cycle of bats. He develops painful spasms, progressive paralysis, coma and dies. His brain biopsy shown in the image. Choose the correct statement about to prevention of this illness

A 36-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a 2-day history of conjunctivitis, sensitivity to bright light, and decreased visual acuity. She denies a history of ocular trauma. She wears contact lenses and thought that the contact lenses may be the cause of the symptoms, although she has always used proper hygiene. Fluorescein staining showed a corneal dendritic branching ulcer with terminal bulbs that stained with rose Bengal. Giemsa staining revealed multinucleated giant cells. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 14 year-old boy with cystic fibrosis comes to the clinic with a persistent cough over the past 2 weeks despite treatment with several oral antibiotics. Temperature is 36.70 C. Pulmonary examination reveals diffuse wheezing. Pulmonary function testing is consistent with an exacerbation of the underlying disease, and the patient is admitted for broad-spectrum intravenous antibiotics and aggressive respiratory therapy. Induced sputum is collected for cultures. In addition to blood, chocolate, and MacConkey agar this patient‘s sputum should also be cultured on which of the following media?

A 35-year-old man is brought to an urgent care clinic by his wife with complaints of dizziness and blurring of vision for several hours. His wife adds that he has slurred speech since this morning and was complaining of difficulty swallowing last night. His wife mentions that her husband was working outdoors and eating stew with roasted beef and potatoes that had been sitting on the stove for past 3 days. The past medical history is unremarkable. The physical examination reveals right eye ptosis and palatal weakness with an impaired gag reflex. The cranial nerve examination reveals findings suggestive of CN V and VII lesions. What is the mechanism of action of the toxin that most likely is causing this patient’s symptoms?
questions.correct_answer: C. Inhibition of release of acetylcholine

questions.text: A 22-year—old woman at 30 weeks gestation presents to the obstetrician with the sudden onset of fever, headache, anorexia, fatigue, and malaise. She mentioned that she had eaten ice cream 3 days ago. Blood cultures show gram—positive rods that are catalase-positive and display distinctive tumbling motility. Choose the correct selective medium for this pathogen.

questions.text: A patient presents with tinnitus. Detailed investigations showed a tumor is the cerebropontine angle. And excision of the tumor was done and histology is as shown in the image. Which of the following is not true about this?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It is frequently seen in association with NF-1 mutation

options.text: The nuclei free areas in the histology are called as verocay bodies.

questions.correct_answer: B. It is frequently seen in association with NF-1 mutation

questions.text: A 52-year old male presents with easy bruise even with small traumas. PBS shows Hb 17g/dl, platelet count 35000/cu.mm. Prothrombin time 11.6 seconds (control 13 seconds) APTT 30 seconds (control 36 seconds). Serum Erythropoietin 2 mU/ml (normal 2-24 mU/ml). Bone marrow examination shows increased erythroid colonies Which of the following is true about this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: JAK mutations is diagnostic of this case

options.label: B
options.text: Ruxolitinib is drug of choice in this patient

options.label: C
options.text: Patient can have budd Chiari syndrome as a complication

options.text: Splenomegaly is either absent of mild in this patient.

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient can have budd Chiari syndrome as a complication

questions.text: A patient presents with high grade fever and joint pain. Serology is positive for NS-1 antigen a diagnosis of dengue fever was made. The platelet count is 14000/cu.mm and the patient doesn’t have any other abnormality physically. What is the next line of management

options.label: A
options.text: Keep under observation and start Antibiotics and antipyretics

options.label: B
options.text: Admit and start Platelet transfusion and give antipyretics

options.label: C
options.text: Keep under observation give fluids and antipyretics

options.label: D
options.text: Give antipyretics fluids and reassure and ask the patient to visit SOS

questions.correct_answer: C. Keep under observation give fluids and antipyretics

questions.text: A 32-year male is planned for an elective surgery. A preoperative workup reveals a bleeding time by finger prick test is 7 minutes, platelet count is 1,25000/cu.mm, PT 15 s (Control 16 s), APTT 45 s (Control 45 s). a peripheral blood examination show relatively larger platelets. Ristocetin aggregation test is abnormal. Which of the following is the most likely etiology for such a manifestation?

options.label: A
options.text: A congenital deficiency of Von Willebrand Factor

options.label: B
options.text: A congenital Deficiency of Glycoprotein IB-IX

options.label: C
options.text: A congenital deficiency of Glycoprotein IIB-IIIA

options.label: D
options.text: A congenital deficiency of granules of the platelets

questions.correct_answer: B. A congenital Deficiency of Glycoprotein IB-IX
